result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marshall Anthony Green

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marshall Anthony Green.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marshall Anthony Green.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Marshall Anthony Green.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee police officer Nicholas Ulatowski. Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee district attorney's office victim witness advocate Tracy Werner. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-25-2022

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State v Lee hearing. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Case set for a State v Lee Hearing on 7/29/22 at 2:00 pm. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case rescheduled to 8/16/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email, including Justice Point.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned FOR CAUSE for a state v lee hearing in Branch 29.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Marlena M.M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Br 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
